column4: I mounted an ntfs share earlier,   and now trying to access the mount point results in this "ls: cannot open directory .: Transport endpoint is not connected"
how can I rectify this as I cannot umount it nor remount it
there is some "force" switch to mount. RTFM. or reboot
remounting it with --force does not work
unmounting also?
though oddly when using -f ,   the resulting error instead of two umount: /home/robf/mnt: device is busy errors,  one has umount2 in place...which is just strange but
i dont know umount2?  - maybe some shell is in this dir or a window showing its (deprecated) contents or there is really a
file opened, or a lock is left over by accident. a reboot should fix it, but thats not a pretty solution. i had a similar problem once
exactly,  I don't like messy solutions
find out, how you can look which process is locking the dir. or kill what looks like it might be accessing
it looks to be something wonky with fuse though
is there a list of the most recently updated files
here's something crazy
did ya see the ls -l of mnt?
no?
i see only question marks
exactly
wow
either something in the filesystem broken or another glitch. i would reboot now. still not the most pretty solution
yeh :(
remember not to flood - lol
I know... heh
nah I just hit enter a bit too often ....
tbh, i have no clue, but that sounds reasonable. it looks like someone forgot to delete a lock file.
